description.narrative: The objective of the project is to strengthen the empowerment of young people for satisfactory and sustainable support for community development. The direct beneficiaries of the project will be 40 young heads of households and 60 tutors of OVCs. Through frameworks integrating all stakeholders which will be put in place, the impact of the actions carried out will be observed through the theoryof change which will materialize by the fact that the young people who were in the situation of the inability to develop themselveswho will become autonomous by putting put in place a system allowing them to obtain income-generating activities themselves by contributing to their families and the municipality to achieve the promotion of Local Economic Development (LED) of PCDC 3rd Generation,and its implementation strategy is clear and responsive to the approach th kind. he Vision of IODC is that the young people of the different communes of the general country and those of the Kanyosha commune in particular have the capacity to Promote local economic development through the Communal Plan for Community Development (PCDC). Vulnerable groups (widows, indigenous people, the disabled; old people) have the ability to contribute to local economic development. Its missionis to select OeVs according to the degree of vulnerability. The objective of the project is to strengthen the empowerment of young people for satisfactory and sustainable support for community development. The direct beneficiaries of the project will be40 young heads of households and 60 tutors of OVCs. Through frameworks integrating all stakeholders which will be put in place, the impact of the actions carried out will be observed through the theory of change which will materialize by the fact that the young people who were in the situation of the inability to develop themselves who will become autonomous by putting put in place a system allowing them to obtain income-generating activities themselves by contributing to their families and the municipality to achieve the promotion of Local Economic Development (LED) of PCDC 3rd Generation, and its implementation strategy is clear and responsive to the approach th kind.

participating-org.narrative: Initiative pour l’Organisation et l Développement Communautaire

The Vision of IODC is that the young people of the different communes of the general country and those of the Kanyosha commune in particular have the capacity to Promote local economic development through the Communal Plan for Community Development (PCDC). Vulnerable groups (widows, indigenous people, the disabled; old people) have the ability to contribute to local economic development. Its mission is to select OeVs according to the degree of vulnerability. The objective of the project is to strengthenthe empowerment of young people for satisfactory and sustainable support for community development. The direct beneficiaries of the project will be 40 young heads of households and 60 tutors of OVCs. Through frameworks integrating all stakeholders which will be put in place, the impact of the actions carried out will be observed through the theory of change which will materialize by the fact that the young people who were in the situation of the inability to develop themselves who will become autonomous by putting put in place a system allowing them to obtain income-generating activities themselves by contributing to their families and the municipality to achieve the promotion of Local Economic Development (LED) of PCDC 3rd Generation, and its implementation strategy is clear and responsive to the approach th kind.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

receiver-org.narrative: Initiative pour l’Organisation et l Développement Communautaire

description.narrative: Civil society actors transformed and strengthened,
CSO actors that build trust and work in inclusive way in coalitions
CSO that improved their acccess to flexible resources to actively address, reclaim and navigate civic space offline and online, involving and considering esp. marginalized groups
CSOs that strengthened the links with their constituencies due to changed ways of working
CSOs with improved risk strategies and improves support when a civic space crisis occurs
CSOs with increased women and youth in leadership positions
informal movements/individuals with access to flexible resources to address, reclaim and navigate civic space offline and/or online
